intro: Pseudogaillonia, commonly known as the false gallionia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae, which includes grasses. These plants are native to various regions of Africa and are typically found in arid or semi-arid environments. They are characterized by their tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Pseudogaillonia species often produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to their hardy nature, they are sometimes cultivated as ornamental grasses in gardens and landscapes.
